So fish don't have tongues and a lot of people are asking about the tongue-eating louse or just wondering about the tongues they have seen in fish. I have found that this part of a fish's body is referred to as the basihyal. (Pronounced like "basil" without the "l" or "basic" without the "c" and then "hi ya'll". Put an s at the end to make it plural.) As they say in the video, it is different from a tongue. It is not muscular, has limited mobility, and is even described as bony. Also fried cod tongues are not tongues either, just a morsel of flesh from the cod's lower throat area.

120 degrees? Well, maybe, if you're only interested in what we can see binocularly. More like 190 degrees otherwise, which is what is being measured in goats and such.

Find a long wall. A long one, like the outside of a large building. Stand with your back against the wall and look straight ahead. You should be able to see the wall peripherally. That means you're seeing more than 180 degrees. In fact, you're seeing 175 degrees with each eye, which isn't far off from what a goat eye sees. The position of the eyes plays a much greater role.

Also, we see 120 degrees *vertically*.

Cymothoa exigua, or the tongue-eating louse is a parasite that eats fishes tongues and then attaches to the stub of the tongue and pretends to be the tongue that is no longer there, it then hangs around in the fishes mouth for free meals.  If fish don't have tongues, how does this louse exist?

You are right, SciShow Quiz Show is the only quiz show called SciShow Quiz Show. But there is another channel called SciShow Quiz Show, and they do a quiz show, but their quiz show is called SciShow Quiz Show Quiz Show. In SciShow Quiz Show Quiz Show you have to answer questions about SciShow Quiz Show, like when the first episode of SciShow Quiz Show was aired. Also there is a quiz show called SciShow Quiz where you you are given a topic and you have to guess in which episode of SciShow it appeared. And finally there are are the shows "the SciShow Show", "Sci Show Quiz - the Show" and "the SciShow Quiz Show Show". They all are actually musicals and Hank is played by Muscle Hank in each.
